20110111182145.000|20110111182148.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  What a difference a year or two 
20110111182148.000|20110111182150.000|TR0|makes. Yesterday was a big day for the 
20110111182150.000|20110111182153.000|TR0|American auto industry. The plug-in Chevy 
20110111182153.000|20110111182155.000|TR0|Volt was named North American Car of the 
20110111182155.000|20110111182158.000|TR0|Year and the Ford Explorer was voted Truck 
20110111182158.000|20110111182200.000|TR0|of the Year at the Detroit Auto Show. 
20110111182200.000|20110111182203.000|TR0|Also, Ford announced it will add thousands 
20110111182203.000|20110111182205.000|TR0|of new jobs in the United States. 
20110111182205.000|20110111182208.000|TR0|Christine Romans, she hosts "Your Bottom 
20110111182208.000|20110111182210.000|TR0|Line," and she joins us now from New York 
20110111182210.000|20110111182213.000|TR0|to tell us what this all means for the 
20110111182213.000|20110111182215.000|TR0|future of the American auto industry --

20110111183801.000|20110111183804.000|TR0|impressive.  But what does it mean

20110111183807.000|20110111183809.000|TR0|
20110111183809.000|20110111183812.000|TR0|Over to our chief medical correspondent, 
20110111183812.000|20110111183814.000|TR0|Dr. Sanjay Gupta.
20110111183814.000|20110111183817.000|TR0|
20110111183817.000|20110111183819.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20110111183819.000|20110111183822.000|TR0|
20110111183822.000|20110111183824.000|TR0|DR. SANJAY GUPTA, CNN CHIEF MEDICAL 
20110111183824.000|20110111183827.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:   Well, Martin, what they 
20110111183827.000|20110111183829.000|TR0|typically mean when they say they've 
20110111183829.000|20110111183832.000|TR0|beaten cancer is that there's no evidence 
20110111183832.000|20110111183834.000|TR0|of disease -- NED, it's called.  You get a 
20110111183834.000|20110111183837.000|TR0|scan, like a CAT scan or a PET scan and 
20110111183837.000|20110111183839.000|TR0|you don't see evidence of disease.  No 
20110111183839.000|20110111183842.000|TR0|evidence of the tumor remaining.
20110111183842.000|20110111183845.000|TR0|
20110111183845.000|20110111183847.000|TR0|Now, as most doctors, health care 
20110111183847.000|20110111183850.000|TR0|professionals will point out, these tests 
20110111183850.000|20110111183852.000|TR0|have a certain limited accuracy.  They're 
20110111183852.000|20110111183855.000|TR0|very good.  But if something, let's say, 
20110111183855.000|20110111183857.000|TR0|is smaller than about six-tenths of a 
20110111183857.000|20110111183900.000|TR0|centimeter, it may be hard to pick up.  
20110111183900.000|20110111183902.000|TR0|And that's why doctors and the teams are 
20110111183902.000|20110111183905.000|TR0|going to be vigilant about following up on 
20110111183905.000|20110111183907.000|TR0|this.
20110111183907.000|20110111183910.000|TR0|
20110111183910.000|20110111183912.000|TR0|Now, I want to point out something about 
20110111183912.000|20110111183915.000|TR0|throat cancer in general.  Throat cancer 
20110111183915.000|20110111183918.000|TR0|is a bit of an umbrella term.  Throat 
20110111183918.000|20110111183920.000|TR0|cancer can mean cancer of the back of the 
20110111183920.000|20110111183923.000|TR0|tongue, of the gums, of the larynx, for 
20110111183923.000|20110111183925.000|TR0|example, anything sort of in that region.  
20110111183925.000|20110111183928.000|TR0|And depending on where the cancer came 
20110111183928.000|20110111183930.000|TR0|from, it behaves differently.  The 
20110111183930.000|20110111183933.000|TR0|likelihood of recurrence is different.
20110111183933.000|20110111183935.000|TR0|
20110111183935.000|20110111183938.000|TR0|Also, what caused it in the first place.  
20110111183938.000|20110111183940.000|TR0|Alcohol and tobacco, for example, are risk 
20110111183940.000|20110111183943.000|TR0|factors.  Human papilloma virus is a risk 
20110111183943.000|20110111183945.000|TR0|factor.  What sort of caused the cancer in 
20110111183945.000|20110111183948.000|TR0|the first place will affect the likelihood 
20110111183948.000|20110111183950.000|TR0|of recurrence.
20110111183950.000|20110111183953.000|TR0|
20110111183953.000|20110111183956.000|TR0|Now, you know, when you talk about 
20110111183956.000|20110111183958.000|TR0|recurrence, the most common location for 
20110111183958.000|20110111184001.000|TR0|recurrence is in the lungs.  So doctors 
20110111184001.000|20110111184003.000|TR0|are, over the next several years, really, 
20110111184003.000|20110111184006.000|TR0|next three to five years, are probably 
20110111184006.000|20110111184008.000|TR0|going to be looking at his lungs as well 
20110111184008.000|20110111184011.000|TR0|as the back of his throat to see if 
20110111184011.000|20110111184013.000|TR0|there's any evidence of recurrence.  And 
20110111184013.000|20110111184016.000|TR0|if so, you know, deciding on a treatment 
20110111184016.000|20110111184018.000|TR0|plan at that point.
20110111184018.000|20110111184021.000|TR0|
20110111184021.000|20110111184023.000|TR0|A lot of people have asked about what is 
20110111184023.000|20110111184026.000|TR0|the treatment for throat cancer.  Well, he 
20110111184026.000|20110111184029.000|TR0|got chemotherapy and radiation.  And it 
20110111184029.000|20110111184031.000|TR0|can be a very tough treatment, but also 
20110111184031.000|20110111184034.000|TR0|can sort of obviate the need for surgery.  
20110111184034.000|20110111184036.000|TR0|If he'd had surgery, for example, on his 
20110111184036.000|20110111184039.000|TR0|larynx, he would have lost his voice, for 
20110111184039.000|20110111184041.000|TR0|example.  So chemo and radiation can be a 
20110111184041.000|20110111184044.000|TR0|good first line therapy.  It can be 
20110111184044.000|20110111184046.000|TR0|curative in certain cases.
20110111184046.000|20110111184049.000|TR0|
20110111184049.000|20110111184051.000|TR0|And in his case it sounds like it did the 
20110111184051.000|20110111184054.000|TR0|job, at least in getting rid of any
